entry.title: Walkabout | James A. Cook | Tucson Artist
entry.summary: Walkabout

entry.title: | James A. Cook | Tucson Artist
entry.summary: A Short History of the Human Race, Affectionately Within the Homeostasis of Geologic Time

entry.title: Paravak | James A. Cook | Tucson Artist
entry.summary: The Winged Victory (Nike) of Samothrace has been re-named and reconfigured to address the existential comingling of victory with death, as well as to elevate the idea of victory over death to a philosophic consideration.

entry.title: Ox Herding / No. 2 | James A. Cook | Tucson Artist
entry.summary: Each piece within this series references the traditional wood block prints of zen philosophy.

entry.title: Economics of Vertical Inclination | James A. Cook | Tucson Artist
entry.summary: Stimulated by some of Sigfried Giedion's ideas regarding the relationship between economics/power and architecture as symbolic constructs, this piece depicts the construction of a beehive as a vertical tower.

entry.title: Cartesian Oar for Lao Tsu's Stream | James A. Cook | Tucson Artist
entry.summary: A bronze cast ‘cardboard’ box with flaps open at one end is situated next to a child’s box guitar, also cast in bronze. The interiors of each echo their respective outer forms—one rather existential and the other with prepubescent hope.

entry.title: American Book of the Dead: La Victoire de Sans-Une-Trace | James A. Cook | Tucson Artist
entry.summary: The Winged Victory (Nike) of Samothrace has been re-named and reconfigured to address the existential comingling of victory with death, as well as to elevate the idea of victory over death to a philosophic consideration.

entry.summary: Each piece within this series references the traditional wood block prints of zen philosophy.

entry.title: Red Nimbus | James A. Cook | Tucson Artist
entry.summary: The plaster torso might be a lost hero, warrior or philosopher, perhaps even a Greek bust of Plato? This plaster sculpture, which has literally lost its head, bears instead the porcelain doll’s head of a child, producing a marriage of mismatched scales an

entry.title: Immanent In A Minute | James A. Cook | Tucson Artist
entry.summary: This two-element sculpture consists of a vertical shaft of bamboo resting on its own rhizomes and a stone next to it.

entry.title: Not Here (One, Interpretation from the Ten Ox Herding Pictures) | James A. Cook | Tucson Artist
entry.summary: The Winged Victory (Nike) of Samothrace has been re-named and reconfigured to address the existential comingling of victory with death, as well as to elevate the idea of victory over death to a philosophic consideration.

entry.title: PIVOT | James A. Cook | Tucson Artist
entry.summary: The impetus to combine manipulated objets trouves with electronic media stems from my commitment to the idea that the former have a high potential to resonate poetically, while the electronic media generate a psychological/emotional immediacy that can be

entry.title: Little Boy Prayer Wheel | James A. Cook | Tucson Artist
entry.summary: The physical similarities of the first nuclear device dropped on the city of Hiroshima and the traditional Tibetan Buddhist prayer wheel to ritually empower prayers are conflated.

entry.title: Like Voices Passing in the Night | James A. Cook | Tucson Artist
entry.summary: The Winged Victory (Nike) of Samothrace has been re-named and reconfigured to address the existential comingling of victory with death, as well as to elevate the idea of victory over death to a philosophic consideration.

entry.title: Conundrum Stump(ed) | James A. Cook | Tucson Artist
entry.summary: This image alludes to the human condition wherein wounds and their remediations are repeated many times during a lifetime.

entry.title: Water Compass in Three Chapters | James A. Cook | Tucson Artist
entry.summary: The Winged Victory (Nike) of Samothrace has been re-named and reconfigured to address the existential comingling of victory with death, as well as to elevate the idea of victory over death to a philosophic consideration.

entry.title: Philosophy of Tides | James A. Cook | Tucson Artist
entry.summary: The central image in this work is that of a combat field stretcher in use during the Second World War . The ripped and frayed canvas stretched across the wooden poles is repaired with vintage catgut issued for emergency field sutures. All of the voids are

entry.title: Supplicant II | James A. Cook | Tucson Artist
entry.summary: The Mechanics of Prayer invites one to turn a large pulley wheel using a modified treadle.

entry.title: American Book of the Dead: The Mechanics of Prayer | James A. Cook | Tucson Artist
entry.summary: The Mechanics of Prayer invites one to turn a large pulley wheel using a modified treadle.

entry.title: Theatre of Annointment | James A. Cook | Tucson Artist
entry.summary: This vertically inclined assemblage of functional objects alludes to figure and gesturally opens to reveal a framed silver pitcher tilting and pouring from above.

entry.title: Tsu Fifty-Five | James A. Cook | Tucson Artist
entry.summary: A old copper clad kettle appears to hover inches above the ground, supported by the long, extended rhizomes of bamboo.

entry.summary: A old copper clad kettle appears to hover inches above the ground, supported by the long, extended rhizomes of bamboo.

entry.title: Tap Dance of Shiva | James A. Cook | Tucson Artist
As Above, So Below (Seven, Interpretations from the Ten Ox Herding Pictures) | James A. Cook | Tucson Artist
entry.summary: This wall piece consists of low-relief stone-like topography, cast in bronze, enclosed by a vintage wooden frame. There is a subtle horizon line spanning across the upper quadrant, separating earth and space.

entry.title: Ascension / Descension | James A. Cook | Tucson Artist
entry.summary: The sculpture has a strong verticality, a feeling of ascendancy. Two forelegs of a horse hover above a waterless font on a porcelain mount, all of which is fixed to a simple wooden box.

entry.title: Conundrum Abode (adobe) | James A. Cook | Tucson Artist
entry.summary: In this work a rational stability is suggested by the adobe block construction as an isolated individual attempts to advance without seeming to progress.

entry.title: Multi-Culturalism in Art Essay | James A. Cook | Tucson Artist
entry.summary: Being an Assistant Professor at this small liberal arts college for the past 7 years has afforded me opportunities to develop courses which bring some multi-culturalism to our students. In addition to the art studio courses, (which include sculpture, bro

entry.title: Statements | James A. Cook | Tucson Artist
entry.summary: I have been developing a body of work having two related, yet distinctive, research paths. The first is philosophically based activity wherein I strive to materialize ideas that are grounded in ontological inquiry and is contextualized to critically exami

entry.title: Icons for Worship Essay | James A. Cook | Tucson Artist
entry.summary: Having limited perceptual and intellectual tools, human beings struggle to explore ontological questions. Signs or symbols expressed in material form, or as thought forms through language, have been employed to engage the noumenal. In diverse cultures glo

entry.title: Biography, Contact, Resume | James A. Cook | Tucson Artist
entry.summary: James A. Cook is currently Chair of the 3-D Division in the School of Art at the University of Arizona. He received his B.F.A. degree from the University of California at Berkeley and M.F.A. degree from the California College of the Arts.

James A. Cook is a sculptor and currently chairs the 3-D Division in the School of Art at the University of Arizona. His sculpture and video work have been extensively exhibited nationally and internationally, and he has participated in residencies, confe

Commentary by the Designer Jackson Boelts of Boelts Design and Web Developer Michael Gatto of Lisantra Technologies about the visual and technical artistry used to present the sculptures and videos of James A Cook, all in Tucson, AZ.
